title: Grammys 2017: Chance the Rapper, Drake Win Rap Grammys
text:
An hour ago Grammys 2017: Chance the Rapper, Drake Win Rap Grammys “No Problem” wins Best Rap Performance, “Hotline Bling” wins Best Rap/Sung Performance and Best Rap Song Photos by Burak Cingi/Redferns, Scott Dudelson/Getty Images 
Chance the Rapper , Lil Wayne, 2 Chainz, and Drake have picked up some rap category trophies at the 59th Annual Grammy Awards . Chance the Rapper, 2 Chainz, and Lil Wayne won Best Rap Performance for “No Problem.” During Chance’s speech (where he wore his “ Thank You Obama ” clothes), he said, “Shit, this is crazy” and thanked presenter Jimmy Jam. Drake won the awards for Best Rap/Sung Performance and Best Rap Song for “Hotline Bling.” Watch Chance’s speech, and see a congratulatory text that Drake apparently sent Chance, below. The moment @chancetherapper won "Best Rap Performance" for "No Problem"  pic.twitter.com/J4oRKfRZx5 — Complex Music (@ComplexMusic) February 13, 2017 
Drake, Kanye, Jay Z, Schoolboy Q, Desiigner, Fat Joe & Remy Ma were all up for Best Rap Performance. Beyoncé, Kendrick, D.R.A.M., Kanye, Chance, and Rihanna were up for Best Rap/Sung Collaboration. Kanye, Chance, Fat Joe & Remy Ma were the other nominees for Best Rap Song. 
For more of Pitchfork’s coverage of this year’s Grammy Awards, click here . A photo posted by Chance The Rapper (@chancetherapper) on Feb 12, 2017 at 4:15pm PST Artists In This Story
